info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 3 at 2:49PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
At 246 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rose Valley to 12 miles east of Santa Ynez. Movement was south at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Brief heavy downpours are possible for portions of the Lake Burn Scar in Santa Barbara County.
Locations impacted include... Highway 154 over San Marcos Pass... Meiners Oaks... Highway 33 between Wheeler Springs and Rose Valley Road... Lockwood Valley... Reyes Peak... Ojai... Old Man Mountain... Big Pine Mountain... Lake Cachuma... Rose Valley... Highway 33 from Lockwood Valley Road to the Santa Barbara County line... and Goleta.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: STRONG SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN VENTURA AND NORTH CENTRAL SANTA BARBARA COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM PDT

area.areaDesc: Santa Ynez Valley; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Lake Casitas; Ojai Valley; Central Ventura County Valleys; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Northern Ventura County Mountains
